articles.author: ABC News
articles.title: Koko the gorilla dies: 'She taught me so much,' trainer says
articles.description: Koko, the western lowland gorilla who learned sign language and became a pop-culture phenomenon human celebrities clamored to rub shoulders with, has died.

articles.author: John Bacon
articles.title: Feds asks court to allow immigrant children to be detained with parents: What we know now
articles.description: The Justice Department on Thursday asked a federal judge to change the rules for detaining undocumented immigrants as the Trump administration presses its effort to halt the separation of children from their parents while continuing the "zero tolerance" polic…

articles.author: Seth Fiegerman and Lydia DePillis
articles.title: Supreme Court rules states can force online retailers to collect sales tax
articles.description: The Supreme Court ruled Thursday that states can compel retailers to collect sales tax from out of state online vendors.

articles.author: Sara M Moniuszko
articles.title: XXXTentacion shooting: Suspect arrested in connection to rapper's murder
articles.description: A Florida magistrate judge has ordered Dedrick Williams, the man suspected of killing rapper XXXTentacion, to be held without bond on a first-degree murder charge, the Broward County prosecutor's office confirmed to USA TODAY.

articles.title: A Night Among the Trump Believers Way Up North

articles.author: Mike Battaglino
articles.title: Trotz hired as coach of Islanders after leaving Capitals
articles.description: Barry Trotz was hired as coach of the New York Islanders on Thursday.Trotz resigned as coach of the Washington Capitals on Monday after leading them to their first Stanley Cup championship since they entered the NHL in 1974. They defeated the Vegas Golden Kni…

articles.title: The Nets' Dwight Howard era is already ending
Unite the Right Organizer Gets Approval for “White Civil Rights” Rally in DC

articles.author: David M. Jackson
articles.title: White House, Kremlin officials lay plans for Trump-Putin summit as John Bolton heads to Moscow
articles.description: National Security Adviser John Bolton is heading to Moscow later this month to help set up a possible meeting between President Donald Trump and Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin, officials said.

articles.author: Karen Weintraub
articles.title: Extinct Gibbon Found in Tomb of Ancient Chinese Emperor's Grandmother
articles.description: The remains appear to be a new species of gibbon, and it was perhaps a pet.

articles.author: KYLE CHENEY
articles.title: Dems say House GOP subpoena for Rosenstein is 'defective'
articles.description: The latest Republican clash with the Justice Department may be delayed for procedural reasons.

articles.title: Corey Lewandowski Dropped By Speakers Bureau After Family Separation Remark
Exactly what Trump's new plan says about merging the Education and Labor departments
articles.description: Read it straight from the report.

articles.title: Intel CEO Brian Krzanich Resigns After Relationship With Employee
articles.description: Brian Krzanich, who resigned after violating Intel’s “non-fraternization policy,” will be replaced on an interim basis by the company’s chief financial officer.

articles.author: Chris Pereira
articles.title: As Sony Limits PS4 Cross-Play, Nintendo Touts Switch/Xbox One Support In New Trailer
articles.description: With an updated Switch version of Minecraft adding cross-play with Xbox One, Nintendo makes sure you know that feature is available.

articles.author: Amy Held
articles.title: 'Why Are They Shooting?' E. Pittsburgh Enraged Over Police Killing Of Black Teen
articles.description: Antwon Rose Jr., 17, was riding in a car suspected of having been used in an earlier shooting. He ran after police stopped the vehicle and was shot three times by an East Pittsburgh police officer.

articles.author: http://www.nytimes.com/by/david-m-halbfinger
articles.title: Sara Netanyahu Indicted on Fraud Charges in Israel
articles.description: The wife of the prime minister is accused of falsifying records to conceal close to $100,000 in expenses, mostly to high-end chefs for private meals.

articles.author: Stephen Rodrick
articles.title: The Trouble With Johnny Depp
articles.description: Multimillion-dollar lawsuits, a haze of booze and hash, a marriage gone very wrong and a lifestyle he can’t afford – inside the trials of Johnny Depp

articles.author: Byline Manual
articles.title: What Is the Summer Solstice? An Astronomer Explains
articles.description: The summer solstice marks the official start of summer. It brings the longest day and shortest night of the year for the 88 percent of Earth's people who live in the Northern Hemisphere.

articles.author: Martha C. White
articles.title: Beijing has tactics besides just tariffs to hurt the US in a trade war
articles.description: China could choose to run a dirty campaign against highly visible products like Starbucks coffee and Apple iPhones in retaliation for Trump's tariffs.
